content.body: annevk: on that note, I think all the issues on deferred fetching are resolved. `NotAllowed` is thrown only on 3p iframes and some such, there is no permission-based model currently
content.formatted_body: annevk: on that note, I think all the issues on deferred fetching are resolved. NotAllowed is thrown only on 3p iframes and some such, there is no permission-based model currently

content.body: Domenic: it's not clear to me we have Gecko or WebKit buy-in at this point. For WebKit it'll require a bit more time anyway.
content.formatted_body: Domenic: it's not clear to me we have Gecko or WebKit buy-in at this point. For WebKit it'll require a bit more time anyway.

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: okay, that sounds reasonable in principle. I hope to have time this week.
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: okay, that sounds reasonable in principle. I hope to have time this week.

content.body: annevk: I'm actually not seeing in the minutes anything about a problem with cross-origin iframes and deferred fetching.
content.formatted_body: annevk: I'm actually not seeing in the minutes anything about a problem with cross-origin iframes and deferred fetching.

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: I think we discussed that much earlier on at one of the Performance WG meetings. I had forgotten about it for a bit though and recently remembered again.
